str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.
Isaiah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Hesaias, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To tell (say) beforehand, forewarn, declare, tell plainly. From pro and lego; to say beforehand, i.e. Predict, forewarn.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Hosts, armies. Of Hebrew origin; armies; sabaoth, a military epithet of God.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Sodom. Plural of Hebrew origin; Sodoma, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To make like, liken; I compare. From homoios; to assimilate, i.e. Compare; passively, to become similar.
Gomorrah, one of the destroyed cities on the Dead Sea. Of Hebrew origin; Gomorrha, a place near the Dead Sea.
